description: Borrowed from French gouache, from Italian guazzo.

entries.meaning: (painting) A thick, opaque watercolour paint made with gum containing an inert white pigment to make it opaque.
examples: Coordinate terms: tempera, oil paint, India ink

entries.meaning: (painting, countable) A painting made with this paint.

verbs.description: gouache (third-person singular simple present gouaches, present participle gouaching, simple past and past participle gouached)

entries.meaning: To produce work in the gouache medium.
